text: <@UEZ3125LL> thanks for your input here as it has really helped me.
CMS agnostic!?! NICE
If I want to Disallow crawlers for one domain in a portal, but not the other, what would that look like in the robots.txt file?
this is what I’m running into… The *override default settings* link is disabled
Robots.txt is more of a global restriction. if you use the robots meta tag in your header you might have better result.
ok, for more info it is a hs-sites domain. Is this blocked by default?
As long as we can crawl the blog, you can use the tool :)

This has some info your looking for:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-general/customize-your-robots-txt-file>

Is anyone else feeling crazy with HubSpot re-logining you in several times for no reason and not allowing you to make simple updates because of some random cookie error? I’m also unable to load templates in Design Tools and keep having to refresh. Saw it a lot last night and still seeing it this morning.
going back to my intial screenshot, the link to override default settings for the `hs-sites` domain is disabled.
From what i remember the hs-sites url is not an actual domain its more of a test staging domain which is prob why its disabled

per <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-general/display-system-subdomains-in-your-domain-manager|this article>
> Although they may be found by search engines, hosting your content on these subdomains will not benefit your <https://academy.HubSpot.com/broadcasts/search-engine-optimization|SEO> as they are HubSpot subdomains. You should <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/how-do-i-change-the-domain-used-for-my-HubSpot-content|connect your own subdomain> to host your content.
the content can be found by search engines
it also states it is a HubSpot subdomain which prob limits your capabilities there
Here’s what I did as a workaround, I set the global setting to `Disallow: /` and then the connected domains had an override link that wasn’t disabled
make sure you override your domains that do want crawlers this would globally disallow all urls
<@U7SL518D6> - good chatting just now :wink: Do you have anything you can add on this topic? I have a couple of opportunities where website performance in China is a key consideration.

Hi Phil, great chatting with you as well.

As for this question I’ll have to get back to you. I don’t know conclusively.
I’m reaching out to some HubSpotters that live in the Asia Pacific region who should know, because of the time zone difference I may not hear back until next week
definitely, thanks!

Hi Phil, got a response back. This is from a partner that  primarily focuses on Chinese businesses. It addresses quite a lot, even beyond the server proximity issue. <https://www.chooseoxygen.com/en/blog/using-HubSpot-in-china-insider-tips-for-optimal-performance>

Thanks Jon. I've seen this article before, it is indeed useful. They basically recommend setting up a website hosted locally in china. This has two main issues, one is it disconnects the content management workflow from HubSpot, and two, there are significant hurdles to cross, like getting an ICP reg. no. - I've no idea how easy or hard that is. Seems like China is still a very tricky market to approach.
Hey <@U25C6PU56> sorry for the trouble, what exactly is occurring with the Design Manager? Any screenshots or console errors you can share?
<@U6W3H6YN8> I will record a video and DM you
Thanks!

Follow up to this. We’re not 100% sure of the exact cause, but if you’re experiencing this issue, try to TURN OFF your HubSpot Sales Chrome Extension in your browser and see if it resolves the issue for you.
some of our users are having the same issue
Any SEMRush experts in here?? I have an issue where my css and js which are in modules are flagging as unmimifed in my site audit. Has anyone else experienced this?
make sure you don't have any errors in your css files. this could cause the minification to not work
Also. check any custom modules you have too as those are not always as ovbious
If there are comments in the code will that affect the minification?
